titleInfo.title: Response of Gliricidia sepium to arbuscular mycorrhizal fungus inoculation and P fertilization in sterile and non-sterile soils

name.affiliation: Department of Botany, University of Calabar, P. M. B. 1115, Calabar, Nigeria.
Department of Botany and Microbiology, University of Ibadan, Ibadan, Nigeria.
Department of Soil Science, University of Calabar, Nigeria.

mods.abstract: A pot experiment was conducted to investigate the effects of arbuscular mycorrhizal fungus (AMF), Glomus deserticola, on the growth of Gliricidia sepium under P 0, 50 and 100 mg kg-1 levels of phosphorus fertilization. Inoculation with AMF increased dry matter yield at all levels of applied phosphorus in both sterile and non-sterile soils while P fertilization at 100 mg kg-1 soil level in conjunction with AMF inoculation increased the dry matter yield by 269.2 and 107.7% in sterile and non-sterile soils respectively. P fertilization increased arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi colonization but decreased mycorrhizal dependency. Colonization by indigenous AMF was, however, significantly (p<0.01) reduced at P 100 mg kg-1 soil fertilization. Foliar N, P and K yields were significantly (p<0.01) increased by AMF inoculation.
